alert.note: Alert for Clarendon; Sumter (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 27 at 10:58AM EDT until March 31 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central South Carolina, including the following areas, Clarendon, Richland and Sumter. * WHEN...Until 100 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1058 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Up to 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Columbia, Sumter, South Sumter, Shaw Air Base, Eastover, Millwood, Poinsett State Park, Oakland, Mulberry, Sumter County Airport, Alcolu, Pinewood, Paxville, Cane Savannah, Privateer, Wedgewood, Cherryvale, Lakewood, Stateburg and Dalzell. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 95 between mile markers 121 and 132. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
